intro: Melampodium microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Melampodium. Its small, capsule-like fruits are a distinguishing botanical feature. Melampodium microcarpum thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
